results.title: Be well: physical fitness in the later years
results.brief_description: This film shows a variety of ways in which older people can stay physically active, or even start exercising regularly for the first time in their lives. Seniors who have incorporated such physical activities into their daily routines are living proof of the rewards.

results.title: Be water wise
results.brief_description: This film discusses basic aspects of water safety, emphasizing the proper method for floating and treading water and the proper procedure for rescue operations. No other credits available.

results.title: Be smart... don't start
results.brief_description: Especially designed for elementary grades at school, this film looks at cigarette smoking and the hazards of starting the habit. It presents opposing opinions and claims of cigarette manufacturers and medical men in an effort to create a lifetime mental attitude toward smoking at this critical age level.

results.title: Be quiet
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Early years at school”.
This film examines the kind of talk in the classroom that can help children in the learning process. Suitable for Tertiary level students and teachers.

results.title: Be prepared
results.brief_description: Discussion starter looking at the necessity for preparation in a group information session. Steve arrives late and is ill-prepared for his demonstration of a new slogan. His equipment fails, he is interrupted by workmen and he loses his audience. Suitable for Upper Secondary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Be it ever so humble
results.creator_credit: John Sparkes, Ron Iddon and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
Shot in Queensland, this film examines the development in styles of houses in Australia, from the slab hut to the contemporary brick house. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiary level students.

results.title: Be clean and healthy
results.creator_credit: Australian Instructional Films and Langton Gould-Marks
results.brief_description: Contrasts healthy children at play with a boy who is “out of everything” because of ill health. Shows simple rules for the care of the body, including the hair and teeth, how to dress comfortably, what to eat, and how to care for eating utensils.

results.title: Be careful boys
results.creator_credit: Oliver Lawson Dick, Biographic Cartoon Films, Vera Linnecar, Nancy Hanna and Keith Learner
results.brief_description: Charlie Burke is a wilfully careless handler of fruit, and is generally unpopular with his fellow workers, the foreman, the producers, the fruiterers and the housewives. A visit to a psychoanalyst reforms him. He acquires a conscience and becomes a model handler, self respecting and respected.

results.title: Be a sport
results.creator_credit: Frank Gardner and Great Britain Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: A survey of sport and athletics in Great Britain, showing several champions and promising newcomers training as well as competing. Johnny Haynes demonstrates the art of ball control; Diane Leather, first women five-minute miler; Gordon Pirie competing in a two-mile event; Christine Truman, tennis star; Pat Smythe shows skill in show jumping; Jeanette Altwegge and Cecilia Colledge, figure skaters. Sporting activities play an important part in the everyday life of English people and a high degree of skill is maintained.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Gardner and Great Britain Central Office of Information
